name: Dmitri Volkov
core_wound: Watched his wife die of radiation poisoning on a failed mining colony, believes only total planetary transformation can make space safe for humanity
wants: To complete Mars terraforming and secure corporate bonuses that will bring his daughter from refugee fleet to safety
needs: To learn that safety cannot be bought with destruction - that some compromises doom everyone
voice_markers: Corporate speak and efficiency language, talks about 'metrics' and 'optimization'
Russian-accented English with occasional Russian phrases under stress
Softens noticeably when discussing his daughter
contradiction: Claims to be making Mars safe for humanity while creating conditions that will destroy colonies

relationships.Kessa Okafor: Views her as idealistic obstacle to progress, grudging respect for her expertise
relationships.Sage: Sees as proof that Mars adaptation is possible but refuses to acknowledge implications
relationships.The Gardener: Initially denies its existence, later views as problem to be solved with engineering
relationships.Admiral Zhang Wei: Sympathizes with refugee crisis, daughter is in Zhang's fleet

physical_description: Late 50s, broad-shouldered and physically imposing, Russian descent, gray hair closely cropped, corporate uniform always immaculate, carries himself with military precision despite civilian role
background: Former mining engineer who lost his wife in the Ceres Station disaster. Rose through corporate ranks through ruthless efficiency. Separated from his daughter when she joined refugee fleet. Views Mars terraforming as redemption - make one world truly safe for humans. Genuinely believes he's saving humanity, not destroying an alien ecosystem.

character_arc.book_1: Suppresses Kessa's findings to protect terraforming timeline and his daughter's future, accelerates nanite deployment, watches with horror as first colony is destroyed but doubles down, believing better engineering is the answer
character_arc.book_2: Daughter's arrival in refugee fleet forces confrontation between his two goals, attempts compromise solutions that satisfy neither corporate nor colonist interests, begins to question if terraforming can succeed
character_arc.book_3: Realizes his methods will kill his daughter along with everyone else, makes ultimate sacrifice to help broker compromise, achieves redemption by accepting he cannot engineer away consequences
